docs.abstract: “I know that whenever an incident like this happens, there is tremendous hurt that can come about,” said Mr. Buttigieg, the mayor, as he returned to the city.
docs.snippet: “I know that whenever an incident like this happens, there is tremendous hurt that can come about,” said Mr. Buttigieg, the mayor, as he returned to the city.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pete Buttigieg pulled himself off the presidential campaign trail on Monday and returned to his day job as mayor of South Bend, Ind., after a police officer there shot and killed a black man.

headline.main: Pete Buttigieg Leaves Campaign Trail After Police Killing of Black Man in South Bend
headline.print_headline: Buttigieg Leaves Campaign Trail After Police Shooting in South Bend

docs.abstract: Eight months before the all-important Iowa caucuses, revelers came to the state’s capital to celebrate Pride — and to hear presidential candidates speak about issues that matter to them.
docs.snippet: Eight months before the all-important Iowa caucuses, revelers came to the state’s capital to celebrate Pride — and to hear presidential candidates speak about issues that matter to them.
docs.lead_paragraph: [Sign up for our politics newsletter and join the conversation around the 2020 presidential race.]

headline.main: ‘I Live This Every Day’: Portraits of Pride in Iowa
headline.print_headline: Draped in Rainbow Flags, and Listening

byline.original: By Sydney Ember and Jake Naughton

docs.abstract: In a field of 23 Democrats, Mr. Buttigieg and Ms. Warren have mastered creating moments for social media and dominating cable news coverage.
docs.snippet: In a field of 23 Democrats, Mr. Buttigieg and Ms. Warren have mastered creating moments for social media and dominating cable news coverage.
docs.lead_paragraph: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa — Pete Buttigieg ran through his stump speech (six minutes on generational change), tossed bean bags with activists (in front of as many cameras as Iowa voters), took seven questions from reporters (“How does it feel to be a rock star?”) and pounded out some blues on an electric keyboard (a Miles Davis tune).

headline.main: How Pete Buttigieg and Elizabeth Warren Cracked the Code of the 2020 Race
headline.print_headline: Buttigieg and Warren Tap Power of Social Media and TV to Stand Out

docs.abstract: The president goes to Orlando, the former vice president invokes two segregationist senators and Elizabeth Warren says she’ll ban private prisons.
docs.snippet: The president goes to Orlando, the former vice president invokes two segregationist senators and Elizabeth Warren says she’ll ban private prisons.
docs.lead_paragraph: We’re trying something new in our 2020 presidential campaign coverage.

headline.main: Trump Kicks Off 2020, Biden’s Backlash, Warren on Prisons: This Week in the 2020 Race

docs.abstract: The stage is set for the first Democratic debates this month, Joe Biden and President Trump square off in Iowa and we round up new policy proposals.
docs.snippet: The stage is set for the first Democratic debates this month, Joe Biden and President Trump square off in Iowa and we round up new policy proposals.
docs.lead_paragraph: We’re trying something new in our 2020 presidential campaign coverage.

headline.main: Democratic Debates, Sanders on Socialism, New Polls: This Week in the 2020 Race

byline.original: By Maggie Astor and Matt Stevens

docs.abstract: Mr. Buttigieg pulled himself off the presidential campaign trail this week after a police officer in South Bend shot and killed a black man. Here’s some context.
docs.snippet: Mr. Buttigieg pulled himself off the presidential campaign trail this week after a police officer in South Bend shot and killed a black man. Here’s some context.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a crowded Democratic presidential primary field, Pete Buttigieg, the 37-year-old mayor of a midsize Midwestern city, has enjoyed a meteoric rise from obscurity that has become the envy of his lesser known rivals.

headline.main: Pete Buttigieg’s Complicated History With the Police and African-Americans

docs.abstract: Already the subject of detailed proposals from several Democratic presidential candidates, the issue of voting rights is now an integral part of the 2020 election.
docs.snippet: Already the subject of detailed proposals from several Democratic presidential candidates, the issue of voting rights is now an integral part of the 2020 election.
docs.lead_paragraph: When the Supreme Court ruled 5-4 on Thursday that federal judges had no power to stop partisan gerrymandering, it brought to a crushing end decades-old questions about the court’s willingness or ability to rein in voting maps drawn to blatantly benefit one party.

headline.main: Voting Rights Were Already a Big 2020 Issue. Then Came the Gerrymandering Ruling.
headline.print_headline: Democrats Were Outraged, the Republicans Were Thrilled, but It’s Far From Over

docs.abstract: During the Democratic debate Thursday night, Senator Kamala Harris recalled Mr. Biden’s opposition to school busing in the 1970s. Here’s a look at the history.
docs.snippet: During the Democratic debate Thursday night, Senator Kamala Harris recalled Mr. Biden’s opposition to school busing in the 1970s. Here’s a look at the history.
docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most tense and dramatic moments of the Democratic debate on Thursday night began with a stipulation.

headline.main: What We Know About Joe Biden’s Record on School Busing

docs.abstract: Senator Kamala Harris confronted the former vice president in a searing moment over racial equality, and others attacked him on policy and generational divide.
docs.snippet: Senator Kamala Harris confronted the former vice president in a searing moment over racial equality, and others attacked him on policy and generational divide.
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Joseph R. Biden Jr. repeatedly found himself on the defensive in the Democratic debate on Thursday over his record as well as his personal views, with the most searing moment of the night, and the primary campaign to date, coming when Senator Kamala Harris confronted him over his comments on working with segregationists in the Senate.

headline.main: Biden Comes Under Attack From All Sides in Democratic Debate
headline.print_headline: Seeking to Knock Front-Runner Off Stride, Rivals Barrage Biden

byline.original: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

docs.abstract: Mr. Biden suffered a setback in his exchange with Kamala Harris, raising questions about his electability and highlighting the unsettled nature of the race.
docs.snippet: Mr. Biden suffered a setback in his exchange with Kamala Harris, raising questions about his electability and highlighting the unsettled nature of the race.
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — A day after a bruising primary debate in which Senator Kamala Harris laced into his history on civil rights, former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. vigorously defended his record on Friday, saying that “30 seconds to 60 seconds on a campaign debate exchange can’t do justice to a lifetime committed to civil rights.”

headline.main: A Day After Bruising Debate, Biden Pushes Back Against Criticism on Civil Rights
headline.print_headline: Biden, After a Bruising Debate, Defends Record on Civil Rights

byline.original: By Julie Bosman and Katie Glueck
